snippet: Officers shot and killed 9 suspects and injured 19 others in 2011, the second-lowest toll in recent city history, a Police Department report said.
abstract: New York City Police Department report shows that in 2011, officers shot and killed 9 suspects and injured 19 others, the second-lowest annual toll in recent city history; annual firearms discharge report indicates that in 36 separate encounters, more than two-thirds of officers involved fired five or fewer shots, suggesting that 'restraint is the norm' in police shootings throughout the city.
lead_paragraph: Officers shot and killed 9 suspects and injured 19 others in 2011, the second-lowest toll in recent city history, a Police Department report said.

headline.seo: N.Y. Police Firearms Report Counts Fewer Shootings in 2011
headline.main: Report Sees More Restraint in Shootings by City Police Officers
headline.print_headline: Report Suggests More Restraint in Shootings by City Officers
